citation.abstract: The status of eastern North America as an independent center of plant domestication has recently been called into question by a number of genetic and archaeological studies, which suggest that the region may not have witnessed the independent domestication of local crop plants, but rather may have been on the receiving end of domesticated crop plants introduced from Mexico. Here, I provide a synthesis of the currently available archaeological and genetic evidence from both eastern North America and Mexico regarding the spatial and temporal context of initial domestication of the four plant species identified as potential eastern North American domesticates: marshelder (Iva annua), chenopod (Chenopodium berlandieri), squash (Cucurbita pepo), and sunflower (Helianthus annuus). Genetic and archaeological evidence provides strong support for the independent domestication of all four of these plant species in the eastern United States and reconfirms the region as one of the world's independent centers of domestication.
citation.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
citation.title: Eastern North America as an independent center of plant domestication

video.title: Paleoindians, Their Descendants and The Book of Mormon
video.summary:
The Book of Mormon disregards the history and accomplishments of the Paleoindians and their descendants.

video.title: Ancient American history and the Book of Mormon
video.summary:
The Book of Mormon is supposed to be a history of Indigenous Americans but it says nothing about their contributions to the world and replaces real achievements of ancient cultures with a fabricated history.

Prelude by Sergey Rybytskyy provided

wikipedia.title: Eastern Agricultural Complex
wikipedia.summary: The Eastern Agricultural Complex denotes the agricultural practices of the prehistoric Eastern Woodland Native Americans in the eastern United States and the First Nations in eastern Canada.

wikipedia.title: Cucurbita
wikipedia.summary: Cucurbita (Latin for gourd) is a genus in the gourd family Cucurbitaceae native to and first cultivated in the Andes and Mesoamerica.

wikipedia.title: Chenopodium berlandieri
wikipedia.summary: Chenopodium berlandieri, also known by the common names pitseed goosefoot, huauzontle, and lamb's quarters, is an annual herbaceous plant in the goosefoot family.

facebook.title: Eastern North America as an independent center of plant domestication
facebook.summary: Quand il s'agit de la domestication des plantes dans le Nord-Est de l'Amérique, on parle souvent de la culture du maïs introduit à partir du Mexique sans mentionner une variété d'autres plantes importantes qui auraient plutôt été domestiquées localement.
